titleStmt.title: C. N. Warren to John W. Finnell
CWG7793

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
B. F. Corlias & Macy, 33 Nassau St. N.Y.
C. N. Warren & Co. BANKERS.
Louisville, Ky., Nov 10th 1862
J. W. Finnell Esq
Dr Sir

Will you be kind enough to speak to the Governor & get my clerk William S. Parker appointed a notary public My former Bookkeeper has left me & going to have one in the office & will go his security -- Tell Ed Newbold that his voucher would not pass muster

Yr very truly.
C N Warren
Gov Robinson -- This note is more for your Deptmt than for ours -- I suppose you know Mr Warren He is a good citizen and a loyal man

Jefferson Co.
Notary
Wm S. Parker
Appd Nov. 11. 1862
